summary: Tested Scheduled Deployments feature - Backend APIs working correctly, Frontend testing blocked by authentication redirect

integration_issues.issue: Admin dashboard redirects to main Expo app due to authentication failure. When accessing /api/admin-ui/dashboard/config-manager, the dashboard layout's useEffect calls api.getMe() which returns 401, triggering redirect to '/' which serves the Expo app instead of admin login
integration_issues.root_cause: Admin backend /admin/auth/me endpoint returns 401, dashboard layout redirects to '/' which is served by Expo frontend

action_items: The frontend testing is blocked because admin dashboard requires authentication. Backend APIs for scheduled deployments are fully functional and tested.
To test the Schedule Deployment dialog UI manually: 1) Login to admin dashboard first, 2) Navigate to Config Manager, 3) Click Scheduled tab, 4) Click 'Schedule Deployment' button
critical_code_review_comments: The Schedule Deployment dialog code in page.tsx is correctly implemented with all required fields (Name, Config Type, Description, Scheduled Date/Time, Duration, Auto-Rollback settings)
Backend API POST /api/config-manager/scheduled-deployments is working correctly - verified via curl and pytest
Dashboard redirect logic (line 117-119 in layout.tsx) could be improved to redirect to /api/admin-ui (admin login) instead of '/' when auth fails
seed_data_creation: Created test deployments via API that are cleaned up after tests
context_for_next_testing_agent: Backend scheduled deployments API is fully working. Frontend admin dashboard requires authentication - use login credentials to test UI. The Schedule Deployment dialog form fields are in place, just need to verify dialog opens and form submission works after logging in.
